column4: I want to start a shell script at login.  While searching on the internet ther seemed to be a ton of different options.  What would some of you guys recomend to be the best.
are you running ubuntu or kubuntu?
#! specifies the interpreter to execute the file with.
so if you put #!/bin/bash, the file is run with bash. if you put #!/usr/bin/python, the file is run with python.
